interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Nepal is the only country that has a flag that is not rectangular or square.
The world's oldest known tree is a bristlecone pine named 'Methuselah', found in California, USA.
China has built the world's largest telescope to study the universe.
The Statue of Unity in Gujarat, India, is the tallest statue in the world.
Brazil boasts the most biodiversity of any country on the planet.
Germany has installed 1 kW of renewable capacity per person in the last decade.
Japan has one vending machine for every 40 people.
